result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel L Gutierrez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angel L Gutierrez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by email for Angel L Gutierrez.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Scheduling Conference held.  Spanish Interpreter Fred Svensson present in court.  Attorney Robert Hampton not available due to appearance in another court.  Parties agree via email to adjourned date.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro in Room 423 of the Safety Building.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Angel L Gutierrez in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Angel L Gutierrez.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Angel L Gutierrez.  Attorney Ian F Vance-Curzan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.   Defense requests a scheduling conference date.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (21 pages) commencing 08-16-22 by KRISTIN MENZIA.

Defendant Angel L Gutierrez in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Angel L Gutierrez in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Angel L Gutierrez appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Fedel. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Information not filed. Defense requests an arraignment. 
  Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Defendant Angel L Gutierrez in court, appear by video with attorney Heather L. Johnson, appear by video.  Defendant Angel L Gutierrez in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Johnson inform court pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court by video, defendant Angel L Gutierrez not in court, in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson to be appointed pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Angel L Gutierrez in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Angel L Gutierrez in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
